channel.title: 317 pi help
channel.description:
When i use my ::item code, it gives me 3 items of the same item im trying to spawn, so eg:
if i type ::item 995 1 gp, it will give 3 gp or ::item 555 1, it will give 3..
how can i fix this i think its simple but i cant find it :\

item.title: 317 pi help
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

xxpkpurexx:

i know but which one should i remove? coz each one has a different use, the 1st 2 dont let you spawn in certain places, the last one is the actually spawning one can you just give me 1 master code please?

Well, what do you want in it? Rip sections of code you want to keep and combine it into one all encompassing method…

item.title: 317 pi help
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

Think about it…

When you type ::item it is calling 3 commands which do basically the same thing so for example typing ::item 995 3 would give you 9 coins? The server is doing the command 3 times if that makes sense so simply remove 2 of the command codes.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 pi help
item.dc:creator: @xxpkpurexx xxpkpurexx
item.description:
@xxpkpurexx wrote:

				if (playerCommand.startsWith("item")) { 
			try {
				String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
				if (args.length == 3) {
					int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
					int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
					if(c.inWild()){
					c.sendMessage("You can't spawn in the wilderness");
					return;
					}
					if(c.inJail()){
					c.sendMessage("You can't spawn In Jail");
					return;
					}	
					/*for (int i : Config.UNSPAWNABLE_ITEMS)
					if (i == newItemID){
						c.sendMessage("This item is unspawnable, obtain it a different way.");
						return;
					}*/
					if ((newItemID <= 25000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
						c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);		
					} else {
						c.sendMessage("That item ID does not exist.");
					}
				} else {
					c.sendMessage("Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))");
				}
			} catch(Exception e) {
				
			}
		}

theres that
and there is this

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if(c.inWild()){
c.sendMessage(“You can’t spawn in the wilderness”);
return;
}
if(c.inJail()){
c.sendMessage(“You can’t spawn In Jail”);
return;
}
/for (int i : Config.UNSPAWNABLE_ITEMS)
if (i == newItemID){
c.sendMessage(“This item is unspawnable, obtain it a different way.”);
return;
}/
if ((newItemID <= 25000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
		}

and this

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights >= 3) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 200 for example 200 gp”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
		}
